snippet: This play makes its case by placing its actors amid the audience members as they enact a crime scene, a protest and a funeral.
abstract: Ken Jaworowski reviews play The Death of a Black Man (a Walk By), written and directed by Ian Ellis James under pen name William Electric Black, at Theater for the New City.
lead_paragraph: This play makes its case by placing its actors amid the audience members as they enact a crime scene, a protest and a funeral.

headline.main: Review: ‘The Death of a Black Man (a Walk By)’ Takes On the Issue of Gun Violence
headline.print_headline: Swept Into a Sea of Fearsome Violence

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The Death of a Black Man (a Walk By) (Play)
